channel.title: BBC News - World

item.title: Afghans 'will struggle to survive or race to escape'
item.description: The BBC's Lyse Doucet reports from the Afghan capital, a day after the last US troops left.

item.title: Amid violent reprisals, Afghans fear the Taliban's 'amnesty' was empty
item.description: Reports suggest the Taliban are searching for, and allegedly killing, people they pledged to leave in peace.

item.title: Brazil bank robbery: Hostages describe terrifying getaway car ordeal
item.description: Brazil hostages describe terrifying ordeal as bank robbers used them as human shields on getaway cars.

item.title: Sarah Rainsford: My last despatch before Russian expulsion
item.description: The BBC's Moscow correspondent has spent much of her life in Russia. This is her final report there.

item.title: Caldor fire: Lake Tahoe deserted as Californians evacuate
item.description: A major wildfire which began weeks ago is still spreading at the popular Californian holiday spot.

item.title: Tokyo Paralympics: Afghanistan athlete Hossain Rasouli makes debut after evacuation
item.description: Afghanistan evacuee Hossain Rasouli finally gets his chance to compete at the Tokyo Paralympics - and his opponents can't "help but feel joy".

item.title: R. Kelly trial: First male accuser testifies to sexual abuse
item.description: An unnamed man says the star promised fame in exchange for sex, while a female witness alleges rape.

item.title: Cyprus on alert as Syrian oil slick spreads across Mediterranean
item.description: Modelling suggests fuel that leaked from a power plant last week will soon reach northern Cyprus.

item.title: YouTube signs Twitch video-game streamer Dr Lupo
item.description: Twitch says it wishes the American, 34, "nothing but the best in everything that comes next".

item.title: Nike is giving its head office staff a week's break
item.description: The sports shoe giant is giving US head office staff this week off after a "traumatic" year.

item.title: Berlin university canteens cut meat from menus to curb climate change
item.description: The new menus are designed to reduce the carbon footprint of universities in the German capital.

item.title: Theranos scandal: Who is Elizabeth Holmes and why is she on trial?
item.description: The former boss of blood testing company Theranos is accused of fraud and could face years in jail.

item.title: Does feeding garden birds do more harm than good?
item.description: How bird feeding could disrupt an ecological balance just beyond our windowsills and gardens.

item.title: Nigerian students amass degrees to stay in Europe
item.description: Modupe Osunkoya enrolled on her third post-graduate degree because she says there are no jobs at home.

item.title: Para-Taekwondo: Taking 360 tornado kicks to Tokyo
item.description: For the first time, the Paralympic games will host a Para-Taekwondo competition.

item.title: Fury as Covid crisis hits Australia's Aboriginal communities
item.description: Indigenous Australians say surging infections in remote areas should have been prevented.

item.title: Can apps move the #MeToo movement forward?
item.description: Reporting sexual harassment at work is getting easier thanks to new technologies.

item.title: Afghanistan: Taliban enter Kabul airport and celebrate by posing in aircraft
item.description: The group entered the Afghan capital's airport hours after the last US soldier left the country.

item.title: The last US soldier leaves Afghanistan
item.description: Major General Chris Donahue was last aboard the final flight before the Taliban took Kabul airport.

item.title: From Bush to Biden: One war, four US presidents on Afghanistan
item.description: Two decades of conflict in Afghanistan shaped the legacies of each of these commanders-in-chief.

item.title: UNHCR 'cautiously optimistic' over working with Taliban
item.description: The UNHCR's Filippo Grandi says there has been some "positive" contact with the Taliban.

item.title: Greta Thunberg: 'I'll go to COP26 if it's safe and democratic'
item.description: Swedish climate activist Greta Thunberg says she does not think November's COP26 summit in Glasgow will lead to "much results".

item.title: What was left behind by US forces?
item.description: As US troops took off from Kabul, they abandoned 73 aircraft - all disabled.

item.title: Left behind in Afghanistan: If I can’t get out, I’ll die
item.description: An Afghan who had authorisation to fly to the UK speaks to the BBC about his struggle to escape.

item.title: Afghanistan drone strike: 'Ten people died here.. including my daughter'
item.description: A family comb through rubble for remains of relatives they say were killed by a US drone strike.

item.title: Afghanistan: Fleeing the Taliban into Pakistan and leaving dreams behind
item.description: The BBC speaks to Afghans fleeing the Taliban into Pakistan at the Chaman Spin Boldak border.

item.title: Gunfire as Taliban celebrate US leaving Afghanistan
item.description: Gunfire rang out as the BBC's Lyse Doucet reported on US troops' departure from Kabul.
